functions package¶

Submodules¶

functions.load_data module¶

functions.load_data.interpolate_nan(data)¶

Interpolates NaN values in the the ECG

Data passed in may contain NaN values where there were strings or blank spaces in the data, causing gaps in the data. This script interpolates over those gaps.

Parameters:data (np array) – a numpy array containing time, first col, and ECG, second col, signals
Returns:numpy array with interpolated NaN values
Return type:1D numpy array, float
functions.load_data.nan_inds(x)¶

Function to handle indices and logical indices of NaNs.

Args
x (1D numpy array): a vector (time or ECG) containing NaN values
Returns:array where True denotes a NaN value func (function): a function which return on all non-zero values, used to index the interpolation
Return type:1D numpy array, bool
functions.load_data.non_zero_func(x)¶

Function which returns non-zero indices of an array

Parameters:x (1d numpy array) – input array
Returns:output non-zero indicies
Return type:inds (1d numpy array)
functions.load_data.read_csv(filename)¶

Definition of read_csv

This function takes a filename and reads in a file and outputs its contents. The file should be in csv format and have 2 columns representing time and voltage measurements.

Parameters:filename (str) – path to a csv file containing ECG data
Returns:numpy array containing two columns, time and ECG voltage
Return type:numpy array
functions.load_data.verify_csv_extension(file)¶

Verifies that the extension of the file passed to read_csv denotes a csv file

Parameters:string (str) – path to input file
Returns:returns if the input file is a .csv file
Return type:bool

functions.process_ecg module¶

functions.process_ecg.calc_duration(data, metrics)¶
functions.process_ecg.filter_ecg(data)¶

Filter the input ECG using a bandpass

Sequential high and low-pass filters create a bandpass effect. The resulting signal will be centered on zero (resting potential).

Parameters:data (2D numpy array) – contains two columns with time and ECG data
Returns:modified array with now-filtered ECG data
Return type:data (2D numpy array)
functions.process_ecg.high_pass_filter(volts, kernel_size=401)¶

High pass filtered the ECG signal

Median filtration will preserve the signal mean around the resting signal.

Parameters:
  • volts (1D numpy array) – voltage measurements of ECG
  • kernel_size (int) – size of the median filter
Returns:

low pass filtered ECG signal
Return type:

volt_filt (1D numpy array)
functions.process_ecg.load_rpeak()¶

Loads a sample R-peak for beat detection

Returns:sample waveform, normalized to 1
Return type:rpeak (1D numpy array)
functions.process_ecg.low_pass_filter(volts, sigma=2, kernel_size=7)¶

Low pass filter function to filter ECG

Parameters:
  • volts (1D numpy array) – voltage measurements of ECG
  • sigma (int) – parameter describing the frequency of the filter
  • kernel_size (int) – size of the Gaussian kernel
Returns:

low pass filtered ECG signal
Return type:

volt_filt (1D numpy array)
functions.process_ecg.nonmax_supression(x)¶

Nonmaximum suppression finds crests of a signal. All other non-maxima found from thresholding are suppressed.

Parameters:x (1D numpy array) – a thresholded signal
Returns:an array of maxima indexes
Return type:max_locs (1D numpy array)
functions.process_ecg.normalize_ecg(data)¶

This function normalizes the ECG signal.

This function scales the signal into a standard range, with R-peaks being brought near 1.

Parameters:data (2D numpy array) – contains two columns with time and ECG data

Returns:

functions.process_ecg.r_peak_detection(data)¶

Detection of R-peaks in an ECG signal

This function loads a sample QRS complex and computes a corrlation on an input ECG signal. Areas of high correction are found via thresholding and nonmaximum suppression is used to detect maxima (R-peak locations).

Parameters:data (2D numpy array) – contains two columns with time and ECG data

Returns:
